_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Frank Brunckhorst Company, LLC in Groveport, Ohio has developed a Risk Management Program in compliance with the Environmental Protection Agencies final Rule 40 CFR Part 68. The regulated substance is anhydrous ammonia with a total inventory charge that is over the threshold quantity of 10,000 lbs. Since the facility is also subject to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's PSM Standard 29 CFR 1910.119, Program 3 is required.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION POLICY AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY

The top priority of Frank Brunckhorst Company, LLC is to provide a healthy and safe work environment for its employees and the surrounding community. In this effort Frank Brunckhorst Company, LLC has developed strict policies and procedures to reduce the risk of an accidental hazardous chemical release. The Process Safety Management (PSM) program acts as a gatekeeper of these policies and procedures.  

The requirements of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA) PSM Standard 29 CFR

1910.119 mirrors that of Risk Management's Prevention Program 3 and therefore has been integrated. Of the

14 PSM elements 13 focus on accidental release prevention and one on emergency planning and response. It

is the commitment of management and employees to follow the established procedures and seek new ways for

improvement.

In the event of an emergency Frank Brunckhorst Company, LLC will evacuate or shelter in place, depending on

the type and magnitude of the emergency.  Frank Brunckhorst Company LLC has a fully trained and equipped Haz Mat response team.  This team trains and drills to enable it to respond to emergencies and mitigate the situation.  The company will contact the Hamilton Township Fire Department as necessary for assistance.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

Frank Brunckhorst Company, LLC is a food distribution center located in Groveport, Ohio. The distribution center includes refrigerated spaces that utilize

anhydrous ammonia as the refrigerant. Anhydrous ammonia is a regulated substance under the Chemical Accidental Prevention Provisions, 40 CFR 68.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM

CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

EPA's Risk Management Prevention Program 3, 40 CFR Part 68(D) and OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard 29 CFR 1910.119 outline the facilities accidental release prevention program. Included are 13 Chemical Specific Prevention steps implemented by Frank Brunckhorst Company, LLC and are summarized below.

Employee Participation - Employees are given shared responsibility with management in the continued evolution of the program.

Process Safety Information - Chemical, equipment, and system information has been compiled to ensure the safe design and operation.

Process Hazard Analysis - What-if Checklist completed to identify potential hazards and minimize their impact.

Operating Procedures - Standard Operating Procedures developed to ensure the safe operation of the process.

Training - Training program established and operators trained to ensure the safe operation of the process.

Contractors - Contractor program established to ensure only qualified and trained contractor work on or near the process.

Pre-Startup Safety Review - Procedures and checklist developed to ensure all safety requirements completed before startup of new or modified process.

Mechanical Integrity - Program developed to ensure equipment and systems installed per design specifications and maintained per manufacturer recommendations and good engineering practices.

Hot Work Permit - Permit program established to prevent the potential of fire/explosion resulting from hot work near hazardous chemicals.

Management of Change - Procedures established to manage process changes to ensure the integrity of the PSM program is maintained.

Incident Investigations - Procedures established to investigate releases that resulted in or could have resulted in a catastrophic rele

ase of a hazardous chemical to prevent reoccurrence.

Compliance Audits - Procedures established to periodically review program implementation and to correct as necessary.

Trade Secrets - Policy implemented to provide all necessary information regardless of trade secrets to ensure the employee safety.



ACCIDENT HISTORY - LAST FIVE YEARS

There is no accident history in the past five years.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Frank Brunckhorst Company, LLC is included in the written community emergency response plan. This facility has its own emergency action plan. The emergency action plan includes procedures for informing the public and local response agencies of a chemical release. The emergency action plan also includes information on emergency health care.

Frank Brunckhorst Company LLC has a fully equipped and functioning Haz Mat team. Frank Brunckhorst Company, LLC coordinates its Emergency Action Plan with Hamilton Township Fire Department.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Frank Brunckhorst Company, LLC has recently performed a hazard analysis per their Process Safety Management and Risk Management programs. Areas for improvement during the hazard analysis were identified and corrective actions recommended. All recommendations are promptly addressed.
